sentences: Tüdruk pääses kimbutajate käest terve nahaga.
context: The Estonian verb 'pääsema' has multiple meanings including: 1) To escape from danger, trouble or difficult situations (e.g., escaping from a sinking ship); 2) To get to somewhere physically or figuratively (e.g., the sun breaking through clouds); 3) To detach or come off; 4) To be able to enter or reach a place. It's an intransitive verb that can describe both physical escape and reaching/attaining something.
